intro: Mahernia vesicaria, commonly known as the bladderleaf. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its distinctive bladder-like leaves that store water. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and produces small yellow flowers in clusters.
